name: Pedro Lemos
body: ![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21270647/18029180/a07f8c2e-6c67-11e6-8ca2-7c63271ec1b9.png) ### About me My research interests are primarily in temporal logics, the problem of future contingents, (indicative and counterfactual) conditionals, and extends to whatever overlaps between these topics and philosophy of language, semantics, and philosophy of logic. ### Papers, or drafts, or unclear thoughts * _The Fading Light of Contingency: On Tense, Modals, and Assessment-sensitivity_ * _Indicative Conditionals and Relative-truth_. * _A Turing Machine for Exponential Function_ * _Report on_ Epstein, R. (2014): Reflections on temporal and modal logic. * _Supertruth-makers_. > A `supervaluations meet truthmakers' sort of thing. * _Where is non-classicality in a theory of meaning?_. ### Talks * Conditionals, Retrospective Judgments, and Relative-truth. Presented in Ninth Principia International Symposium: Possible Worlds and their Applications in Philosophy and the Sciences, 2015, Florian√≥polis, 2015. ### Awards * 'Nota 10 Fellowship', 2009 ...One-year fellowship awarded annually by FAPERJ (Rio de Janeiro State funding agency), to a Ph.D./M.A student enrolled in a graduate program ranked 5 or above by CAPES (Brazilian national funding agency) * $4.17 awarded for a full description of a single-tape Turing Machine which computes the exponentiation function f(x,y)=x^y (as advertised in Epstein & Carnielli (2008): _Computability. Computable Functions Logic and the Foundations of Mathematics._ Wadsworth & Brooks/Cole Mathematics Series; p.82) ### Miscellaneous
